newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville not offering power for Thurs peak hours.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville not offering power for Thurs peak hours.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration today declined to offer next-day power during peak demand hours and is limiting off-peak sales to 600 megawatts.
A trade source at the Portland, Ore.-based agency attributed the shift to a balance between its own load demand and generation.
Bonneville said earlier the end-August expiration of extra dam flows needed for fish migration has trimmed its hydroelectric operations.
The federal power marketing agency's price for both firm and non-firm power during hours 0100 to 0600 on Thursday is unchanged from Wednesday at $13.00 per megawatt hour.
On Tuesday, Bonneville also offered pre-scheduled power for Wednesday at $20.00 during peak-demand hours.
